item.title: Caladenia tentaculata
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: 3 images with a focus on the clubbed-sepals and non-clubbed petals, a helpful diagnostic feature of this species.

item.title: Thelymitra peniculata
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: Location approximate. 2 pics, 2nd one showing the post-anther lobe from above.

item.title: Thelymitra nuda
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: Approximate location. 2 pics, 2nd one front-on image of the flower.

item.title: Thelymitra juncifolia
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: Location approximate. 2 pics.

item.title: Wurmbea latifolia subsp. vanessae
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: An unexpected find at the Reserve. Uncommon species; also of note is the late flowering time. Often flowering 'nancies' are one of the first signs of spring flowering from July/August. 2 pics with images of the same plant taken one day apart

item.title: Thelymitra pauciflora s.s.
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: Unusual creamy white coloured Thelymitra Pauciflora. Was seen in the company of the more usual coloured blueish-mauve T. pauciflora and also T. rubra. (2 pics.)

item.title: Myrmecia nigriscapa
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: Several (individuals) of these large Bulldog ants seen in the area. It was watching me just as I was keeping a wary eye on it.

item.title: Thelymitra flexuosa
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: A warm day encouraged several Twisted Sun Orchids to open fully. 3 images; one showing twists in the stem.

item.title: Caladenia pusilla
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: 2 images.

item.title: Caladenia catenata s.s.
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: Several individual plants observed; all one flowered apart from this plant which was 2 flowered. Some variation across different plants e.g. pink markings (looking a little like transverse bars) on the labellum.

item.title: Caladenia catenata s.s.
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: Several individual plants observed; all one flowered apart from one plant which was 2 flowered. Some variation across different plants, e.g. the calli were yellow on this plant.

item.title: Caladenia catenata s.s.
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: Several individual plants observed; all one flowered apart from one plant which was 2 flowered. Some variation across different plants with the calli white or yellow (see separate post), and one plant had very faint pink markings on the labellum (see separate post).

item.title: Caladenia fuscata
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: White coloured C fuscata (Dusky Fingers). ID'd on the basis of features such as the forward-pointing triangular extensions on mid-lobes, lack of yellow on lip/tip of labellum, glands on back of dorsal sepal and underneath sepals and petals. However noted a lack of prominent red transverse stripes on and underneath the labellum. Other C. fuscata nearby displayed the stripes extending further up the lobes and underneath the labellum. Just a variation perhaps in this plant? 4 pics.

item.title: Cyanicula caerulea
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: From a distance it looked faintly mauve but I'd appreciate confirmation that it's a white form of Cyanicula caerulea (Blue fingers/Blue fairy). 2 pics.

item.title: Fomitopsis spp.
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: 3 images. Possibly Fomitopsis lilacinogilva ? Growing on dead trunk of Acacia pycnantha (Golden Wattle).

item.title: Unidentified
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: 4 images. Single specimen <5cm, growing in damp weeds in the car park. Cap diameter 2.5 cm. Cap disintegrating. Possible(??) same species as I observed in the area 4 weeks ago and posted on NatureShare. ID appreciated.

item.title: Pterostylis nana
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: Dwarf Greenhood orchid. 2 images, one showing rosette leaves.

item.title: Parasola plicatilis
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: Single specimen <5cm, growing in sandy soil and damp moss. Area was quite moist after a couple of days of consistent rain. Caladenia sp. leaf (possibly C. parva) on the left in the image.

item.title: Pterostylis concinna
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: 2 photos, one showing basal rosettes of several non-flowering plants. This is a common winter-flowering orchid in my local patch.

item.title: Corybas incurvus
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: 4 images of Slaty Helmet-orchids with flowers in various stages of development. Newly emerging flowers appeared in mid-July. 2 weeks later in early August the flowers were fully formed.

item.title: Corybas diemenicus s.l.
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: Three images.

item.title: Ecnolagria grandis
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: I note other photos of the same species uploaded today. Must have been a good day for observing these common beetles!

item.title: Eucalyptus pauciflora, Paropsis atomaria
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: Larvae found on the underside of a leaf on Eucalyptus pauciflora (Snow gum).

item.title: Glyphipterix meteora, Lobelia pratioides
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: A single Glyphipterix meteora moth. Other Glyphipterix meteora moths had been observed on Burchardia umbellata (Milkmaids) the previous day. Interesting to see a similar photo by Russell Best (below) in this Lobelia species list with the same moths, plus a beetle. As mentioned by Russell Best the moth appears to be feeding from below.

item.title: Scopula rubraria
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: Single moth flowing low and stopping constantly in the long grasses. Lighter coloured form to others on this page. I note Cathy's comments about the variability in colour of this species.

item.title: Burchardia umbellata, Glyphipterix meteora
item.dc:creator: bernie_l
item.description: Glyphipterix meteora moths enjoying the pollen on Burchardia umbellata (Milkmaids). Moth ID provided by Marilyn Hewish.
